name: Artix Linux (OpenRC)
install_guide_markdown:
# Artix Linux (OpenRC) Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 1GB RAM minimum
- 15GB disk space
- Advanced Linux knowledge
- USB drive (2GB+)

## Key Features
- Based on Arch Linux
- Uses OpenRC init system instead of systemd
- Cutting-edge rolling release packages
- Community-driven development

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get OpenRC version from artixlinux.org mirrors

## Step 2: Create Bootable USB
Use dd or Etcher

## Step 3: Boot Live System
Select XFCE or CLI option

## Step 4: Partition Disk
Use cfdisk or parted

## Step 5: Format and Mount
Format partitions and mount to /mnt

## Step 6: Run Installer
Use `basestrap` to install base system

## Step 7: Configure System
Edit /etc/rc.conf and other system files

install_steps.title: Download Artix ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Choose XFCE (2GB) for graphical installer or base CLI (700MB) for manual installation.

install_steps.title: Create Bootable USB
install_steps.detail_md:
Write ISO to USB:
```
sudo dd if=artix-linux-openrc-xfce-x86_64.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M
```

install_steps.title: Boot Installer
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB, restart, and select USB from boot menu. Choose XFCE or CLI.

install_steps.title: Partition Disk
install_steps.detail_md:
Use cfdisk to partition:
```
sudo cfdisk /dev/sda
```
Create boot (500MB) and root (remaining) partitions.

install_steps.title: Format Partitions
install_steps.detail_md:
Format partitions:
```
sudo mkfs.fat -F 32 /dev/sda1
sudo mkfs.ext4 /dev/sda2
```

install_steps.title: Mount Filesystem
install_steps.detail_md:
Mount partitions:
```
sudo mount /dev/sda2 /mnt
sudo mkdir -p /mnt/boot
sudo mount /dev/sda1 /mnt/boot
```

install_steps.title: Run Installer Script
install_steps.detail_md: Execute installer from XFCE menu or run calamares command.

install_steps.title: Configure System
install_steps.detail_md: Edit rc.conf, hostname, locale settings. Install additional packages with pacman.
